block.p: Catherine Susan Konovaliv and Andrew John Raab are to be married this afternoon by Mayor Ingrid Sheldon of Ann Arbor, Mich., at the Michigan League in Ann Arbor.
The couple graduated from the University of Michigan and are graduate students at Stanford University. The bride is studying for a master's degree in education and the bridegroom for an M.B.A.
Catherine Susan Konovaliv and Andrew John Raab are to be married this afternoon by Mayor Ingrid Sheldon of Ann Arbor, Mich., at the Michigan League in Ann Arbor.
The couple graduated from the University of Michigan and are graduate students at Stanford University. The bride is studying for a master's degree in education and the bridegroom for an M.B.A.

The bride, 25, is the daughter of Susan and Anthony Konovaliv of Plymouth, Mich. Her mother is a guidance counselor for the seventh and eighth grades at Plymouth Canton High School in Canton, Mich. Her father is the operations manager at Diversified Chemical Technologies in Detroit.

The bridegroom, 26, is a son of Judith and Sheldon Raab of Larchmont, N.Y. His mother is an associate counsel in the State Office of Court Administration in New York. His father is a partner in Fried, Frank, Harris, Shriver & Jacobson, a law firm in New York.
